name: Logis Hotel des Cayrons

reviews.text: Arrived late to find no food available even though table d'hote is displayed boldly outside. We were shown to our tiny room and told it was about a half hour walk into town, what we weren't told was that the road was very busy sometimes with no pavement and no lights. On recommendation from our host we had booked a larger room to find it had one double bed and a child's bed which is not really suitable for 2 single ladies. The decor was circa 1980s and more fitting to a cheap Blackpool boarding house; my knees touched the door when I sat down in the loo and I could not turn round in the shower room and I am only 5ft 2in! There was constant noise from the traffic of the busy road outside. We tried to check out after the first night but were told that we would to have to pay. After some discussion our host said we could check out for the last night but was not at all happy when we told him that 92 euros with no breakfast was expensive for a 2 star hotel (although this hotel doesn't even warrant a a 1 star!). Don't book this hotel it is horrible.

reviews.text: We can only repeat the fulsome praise from other reviewers on this site. We stayed with our two small children for four days, in the self contained studio with kitchen, which was plenty large enough for us all, with its own sitting area. With the kitchen you can buy your own breakfast and we really enjoyed sitting in the sun with views of the hills with the kids and not worrying about ruining anyone else's meal! The hotel is near a road, which you can hear from the pool, though not the room, and as others have said the outside decor could do with a bit of tidying up, but somehow this does not really matter, as it is such a convenient and relaxing place to stay, with the boulangerie so near, and Vence so accessible (this is a really beautiful town, I would say nicer than St Paul). We enjoyed the pool, dinner at the tennis club, with kids, and being able to drive around the area so easily. Tom and Ruth were wonderful, welcoming and helpful. If you have a young family I would strongly recommend staying here, and visiting Marineland, and the local beaches (with the one caveat that the sea at Cagnes is a bit wavy for non-swimming small children, we found the bay at Garoupe on the Cap d'Antibes better, the private beaches looked a good place to spend the day if expensive, but get there earlier than us (ie 10am) to secure a place!)All in all extremely good.
reviews.title: lovely stay

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very cozy. The hotel owners are vey welcoming, helpful, ready to give you all the best tips and ways to go around the area. The breakfast is very good and, at least during summer time, it was served by the pool creating a very relaxing and enjoyable moment. The rooms were spotless and well equiped, and the decoration was very charming. The only thing is that the rooms were a bit small and the beds could be not so soft.

description: Speaking English and French fluently, the Hotel des Cayrons in Vence has been managed by Tom and Ruth for 9 years. Close to St Paul de Vence as well, we are ideally placed for your trip to the Riviera, being roughly equidistant between St Tropez and Monaco, 20 minutes from Nice (15 from the airport), 30 minutes to Cannes and 55 minutes to Monte Carlo/Monaco and 20 minutes from Marineland. All 11 rooms are ensuite, have individually controlled reversible air-conditioning, free wifi, ipod dock/charger/radio/alarm, FREE COURTESY TRAY, fridge, flat screen TV with French, English and Italian channels, hairdryer, safe, double glazing and lots of modern plugs to charge your phones etc. Our pool, refurbished in 2011 and with new furniture in 2012, is by our 2014 new summer salon with its' new loungers and furniture and breakfast is served on the terrace next to it in high summer.
